global.q: Do you rank or recommend providers?
global.a: No. We do not rank, recommend, or endorse providers. Listings and advertising are separate from editorial content.
No. This is an educational publisher. We do not sell leads or referrals.

global.q: How do I verify a license?
global.a: Use the official state or agency verification tool for the relevant profession. Always verify independently.

global.q: How should I compare two quotes?
global.a: Compare scope, not slogans. Require an itemized, written scope and an itemized price that shows what is included, excluded, and what triggers add-ons.
No. Advertising placements are labeled “Advertising” and are intended to be visually separate from editorial content.

global.q: Where can I read your editorial policy?
global.a: See the Editorial Policy page for how we write, update, and correct content, and how we separate ads from editorial.
Through clearly labeled advertising placements. We do not sell referrals; advertising is separate from editorial content.

global.q: Can providers request a correction or update?
global.a: Yes. Providers can request factual corrections (e.g., official website URL) via the contact page. We verify before updating.
We collect only the minimum needed to operate the site. See the Privacy page for details and choices.

global.q: What sources should I trust first?
global.a: Start with official sources (state licensing boards, agency sites, and primary documentation) and verify any claims independently.

city.q: Who is the best provider in {{city}}?
city.a: There isn’t one best for everyone. We do not rank or endorse providers. Shortlist options and compare verification, scope, pricing transparency, policies, and fit for your situation.

city.q: How much does this service cost in {{city}}?
city.a: Costs vary widely based on scope and complexity. Get itemized, written quotes and compare the same scope across providers.

city.q: How do I verify a license in {{stateName}}?
city.a: Use the official state verification tool for {{stateName}} and confirm active status and any public discipline history.

city.q: What are common red flags in {{city}}?
city.a: Pressure tactics, vague pricing, no written scope, unwillingness to discuss alternatives/risks, and unclear policies are common red flags.

city.q: Do you list every provider in {{city}}?
city.a: No. Directories may be incomplete and informational only. We do not rank or endorse providers. Providers can request updates via the contact page.

city.q: How do I avoid scams in {{city}}?
city.a: Verify identity and licensing using official sources, insist on written scope + pricing, avoid pressure tactics, and be cautious with unusual payment requests.

city.q: What should be in a written quote in {{city}}?
city.a: An itemized scope, itemized price, assumptions, exclusions, and the conditions that trigger add-ons or changes.

city.q: Should I get more than one opinion in {{city}}?
city.a: For complex, high-cost, or high-stakes decisions, getting multiple opinions or quotes can reduce errors and improve fit.

city.q: How do I file a complaint in {{stateName}}?
city.a: Use the official complaint process for {{stateName}} (state board or relevant agency) and keep documentation of what occurred.

city.q: Can you update or remove a listing for {{city}}?
city.a: You can request updates via the contact page. We prioritize factual accuracy and may remove entries that are clearly incorrect or outdated.
